issue.title: [Rust] Inconsistent method naming between BinaryArray and PrimitiveArray
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-4042](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4042). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
PrimitiveArray has value() and BinaryArray has get_value() .. suggest we standardize on one convention

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4042?focusedCommentId=16722977) by Neville Dipale (nevi_me):*
I'd advocate for get_value() as it's more explicit for a function. If this is the path taken, what about other functions like Schema::fields()? I think we could target making various getter functions more consistent, in addition to the value/get_value one.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4042?focusedCommentId=16736760) by Andy Grove (andygrove):*
Issue resolved by pull request 3343
<https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3343>
